name: An Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
details: A guide for undergraduate students in AI
longdetails: The course introduces the variety of concepts in the field of artificial intelligence. It discusses the philosophy of AI, and how to model a new problem as an AI problem. It describes a variety of models such as search, logic, Bayes nets, and MDPs, which can be used to model a new problem. It also teaches many first algorithms to solve each formulation. The course prepares a student to take a variety of focused, advanced courses in various subfields of AI.
author: Swayam
courseLayout: Modeling a Problem as Search Problem, Uninformed Search
Bayesian Networks Learning & Inference, Decision Theory
Introduction to Deep Learning & Deep RL

name: Blockchain and its Applications
longdetails: In the last few years, Blockchain technology has generated massive interest among governments, enterprises, and academics, because of its capability of providing a transparent, secured, tamper-proof solution for interconnecting different stakeholders in a trustless setup. In January 2021, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeiTY), Government of India, published the first draft of the "National Strategy on Blockchain" that highlights 17 potential applications that are of national interest. Against this backdrop, this subject will cover the basic design principles of Blockchain technology and its applications over different sectors. Additionally, the course also provides tutorials on setting up blockchain applications using one of the well-adopted permissionless blockchain platforms - Ethereum, and one permissioned blockchain platform - Hyperledger.
author: Swayam
courseLayout: Introduction to Blockchain Technology and its Importance
Basic Crypto Primitives I – Cryptographic Hash
Basic Crypto Primitives II – Digital Signature
Smart Contract Hands On I – Ethereum Smart Contracts (Permissionless Model)
Smart Contract Hand On II – Hyperledger Fabric (Permissioned Model)

name: Python with IIT Certification
longdetails: Whether you have never programmed before, already know basic syntax, or want to learn about the advanced features of Python, this course is for you! This free Python course will give you that core, solid understanding of the Python programming language. You will not only be learning Python, but you will be learning industry best practices for Python programming that real employers demand. Python is a popular programming language used across industries, from tech to finance, and can help you land jobs in data analysis, software development, and more. With our beginner-friendly curriculum, you'll be able to confidently use Python in everyday applications and understand its potential for advanced programming. Plus, with a Python IIT certification, you'll have a valuable credential to showcase on your resume.
author: GUVI
courseLayout: Beginer - Course Overview, Why Python, Python IDE, Hello World Program, Numbers and Math Functions, Common Errors in Python
Intermidiate - Variables & Names, String Basics, Conditional Statements, Functions, For and While Loop
Advanced - Functions as Arguments, List, Tuple, Dictionaries, List Comprehension, File Handling, Debugging in Python, Class and Objects
Expert -  Lambda, Filters and Map, Python PIP, Read Excel Data in Python, Python MySQL, Iterators, Pickling, Python JSON

name: Microsoft Cybersecurity Analyst Professional Certificate
longdetails: Launch your career as a cybersecurity analyst. Build job-ready skills for an in-demand career in the field of cybersecurity in as little as 6 months. No prior experience required to get started.
author: Coursera
courseLayout: Introduction to Computers and Operating Systems and Security
Introduction to Networking and Cloud Computing
Cybersecurity Identity and Access Solutions using Azure AD
Advanced Cybersecurity Concepts and Capstone Project
Microsoft SC-900 Exam Preparation and Practice

name: Java for Beginners
details: Learn how to build highly scalable software applications using Java and master all of its core concepts
longdetails: Master all the basics of Java programming and learn to code like a pro with the best Java for a course that has been designed and taught by industry experts with years of experience in tech. Throughout this Java online course, you will learn major Java concepts such as object-oriented programming (OOP) using Java, JSP, Servlets, and MySQL, along with design principles, best coding practices, and how to write code like a professional developer. You will be able to implement all that you learn with real-world projects and build a great portfolio that will help you excel at interviews. After completing this Java course for beginners, you will gain a certificate that will help your resume stand out from others when applying for developer roles.
author: GUVI

name: Python Zero to Hero
details: Master the most and we really do mean THE MOST used and always in high-demand programming language ever: Python
longdetails: Master the core concepts of coding with Python in this expert course crafted and taught by top industry mentors with years of professional coding experience, who know and train the kind of quality coders that top companies hire. In this course, you will be taught many basic as well as advanced concepts such as Comments in Python and Docstrings, Datatypes and Built-in datatypes, Defining and Calling a Function, Returning Results, MRO, Polymorphism, Overloading, Overriding, Errors and Exception Handling, Thread Communications and much more by implementing them practically as you learn to write top-grade Python code on our award-winning practice platforms by yourself throughout the course. You will gain proficiency in all these concepts by implementing them first-hand with various practice quizzes and top coding hacks that you can flaunt in your technical interviews to impress future employers. Upon completion, you will also be awarded a globally-recognized certificate, endorsing the skills you have acquired.
author: GUVI
requirement: Basics of the Python programming language

name: Blockchain
details: Gain the knowledge of key concepts in Blockchain technology like Cryptocurrency transactions, Bitcoin, blockchain development frameworks & more through this comprehensive course.
longdetails: With this Blockchain certification course, you will understand this revolutionizing technology from a business perspective with real business use cases of huge corporations such as IBM, Honeywell Aerospace, and Walmart which will be taught by industry experts. You will learn about all the essential concepts of Blockchain such as Distributed Ledger, P2P blocks, Immutability, Provenance, Decentralisation, Smart Contracts, and Inclusivity. This Blockchain course will help learners venture into designing and building industry-grade blockchain products and solutions. Additionally, this course is completely self-paced and you will earn a globally recognized certificate upon its completion.
author: Guvi
courseLayout: Understanding Data Distribution, Synchronization and Integrity
IBM Food Trust - Technology in detail

name: Artificial Intelligence: Knowledge Representation And Reasoning
longdetails: An intelligent agent needs to be able to solve problems in its world. The ability to create representations of the domain of interest and reason with these representations is a key to intelligence. In this course we explore a variety of representation formalisms and the associated algorithms for reasoning. We start with a simple language of propositions, and move on to first order logic, and then to representations for reasoning about action, change, situations, and about other agents in incomplete information situations. This course is a companion to the course “Artificial Intelligence: Search Methods for Problem Solving” that was offered recently and the lectures for which are available online.
author: Swayam
courseLayout: Week 2: Symbolic Reasoning. Truth, Logic, and Provability.
Week 3: Propositional Logic. Direct Proofs. The Tableau Method.
Week 4: First Order Logic. Universal Instantiation. The Unification Algorithm.
Week 5: Forward and Backward Chaining. The Resolution Refutation Method.
Week 6: Horn Clauses and Logic Programming. Prolog.
Week 7: Rule Based Systems. The OPS5 Language. The Rete Algorithm.
Week 8: Representation in First Order Logic. Conceptual Dependency.
Week 9: Frames. Description Logics and the Web Ontology Language
Week 10: Taxonomies and Inheritance. Default Reasoning.
Week 11: Circumscription. Auto-epistemic Reasoning. Event Calculus
Week 12: Epistemic Logic. Knowledge and Belief.
